section.title: Introduction
section.p: Simal is an open source framework for building systems for use by those who need to inform a community about the activities of multiple projects that may be hosted in multiple locations. Each project maintains an entry within the Simal project catalogue by means of an RDF/XML file. This entry contains a description of what the project is doing, team members, community structure, deliverables, etc. Simal uses this file to gather a range of information about the projects and presents it in various forms to suit a variety of uses, such as a web site, or PDF document.

Simal also provides a web application for the creation and management of catalogues built using this system. This application allows users to identity projects of interest to their community and generate customised catalogues for their own use, within their own projects website.

The generated catalogues present a useful community development and support tool. They enable users to quickly and easily track activity in multiple related projects from a single location. Thus a project's outputs are visible beyond its immediate community. By exposing relevant outputs to a wider community we hope to increase the level of interaction between related projects.
The project is very young at this time. As such, we welcome input into the requirements and design of the initial prototype system.

section.title: Project Registry
section.p: The project registry is built by importing Description of a Project (DOAP) files into an RDF repository. This catalogue can then be used to find relationships (either existing or potential) between projects and their participants.

section.title: Status
section.p: The registry is currently at an early stage of development, we welcome requests for features via our mailing lists. For more information about the current status see our issue tracker and recent changes document (you can subscribe to a changes RSS feed if you prefer).

section.title: Developer Information
section.p: The registry is found in our uk.ac.osswatch.simal.core SVN module. Project management tools are available on our developer website and mailing lists.
Documentation for the core module is available.

section.title: Management Web Application
section.p:
Once made available to the system these DOAP files are aggregated and presented in various ways that allow a catalogue of projects to be presented and manipulated.
We host a demo server which runs a version of Simal that reflects the latest developments.
